author: bridge-bot
content: <drinkcoffee2022> I have been working on three EIPs for the API between sequencers and provers. They have already had feedback and contribution from people at Polygon, Immutable and Gateway, and have leveraged the good work from Polygon, Scroll, Linea, Taiko, and MatterLabs. The EIPs are very much work in progress. Your feedback would be much appreciated. So that this channel wouldn‚Äôt become too noisy, the discussion for the drafts is in another Telegram channel. React with a üçí if you would like to be added to the channel.

author: bridge-bot
content: <drinkcoffee2022> https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXa.md (https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXa.md) defines the information returned by a JSON RPC call between the prover and the sequencer. Any profile of the other EIPs should fit into this EIP.

author: bridge-bot
content: <drinkcoffee2022> https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXb.md (https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXb.md) defines the consensus information returned by a JSON RPC call between the prover and a decentralised sequencer node, and related configuration and contracts. This EIP facilitates proof of consensus. That is, a zk rollup proving that decentralized sequencer nodes came to consensus on the order of blocks. At present, this EIP focuses on consensus protocols that rely on a threshold number of signers signing a block header (think QBFT and PoS on top of QBFT). I haven‚Äôt thought through how this would need to change to prove other consensus protocols that might be used by decentralized sequencer blockchains. Feedback would be appreciated.

author: bridge-bot
content: <drinkcoffee2022> https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XX (https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXb.md)c.md (https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXb.md) defines the minimal set of information to be proven, required for crosschain bridging from L2 to L1. I know zk bridging for zk rollups is a hot topic and welcome contributions.

author: bridge-bot
content: <drinkcoffee2022> https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXc.md (https://github.com/drinkcoffee/EIPs/blob/prover-client-api/EIPS/eip-75XXc.md) defines the minimal set of information to be proven, required for crosschain bridging from L2 to L1. I know zk bridging for zk rollups is a hot topic and welcome contributions.
